wikitext.*:
{{video game infobox
| image = LotRRealmsInExileLogo.png
| name=The Lord of the Rings: Realms in Exile
| developer=
| publisher=
| platform=Microsoft Windows
| releasedate=November 18, 2020
| genre=Grand Strategy
|}}

'''The Lord of the Rings: Realms in Exile''' is a modification for the PC-game ''[[wikipedia:Crusader Kings III|Crusader Kings III]]'' of the Crusader King series by [[wikipedia:Paradox Development Studio|Paradox Development Studio]]. It changes Europe's map to a map of [[Middle-earth]], while retaining grand strategy and character-based simulation of the original.

It features an extensive, detailed map of Middle-earth for players to engage with, including extensive non-canon south-western geography. It has drawn (non canon) supplemental material from the [[Middle-earth Role Playing]] tabletop RPG and [[Lord of the Rings Online]] to flesh out the expansive world.

[[IMAGE:LotRRealmsInExileMap.png|thumb|left|The playable area available in Realms in Exile.]] {{blockquote|Realms in Exile refers to the kingdoms that formed after the destruction of the isle of [[Númenor]]. These are [[Arnor]], [[Gondor]], [[Umbar]], [[Bellakar]] and [[Army of the Southern Dragon|Thôn an-Khârlôkh]]. Gondor features in the third book of The Lord of the Rings. It is ruled by the stewards of [[Minas Tirith]], as their king was lost in a duel with the [[Witch King]] of [[Minas Morgul]]. Arnor is the lost realm of the north, [[Aragorn]] is chieftain of its few survivors. Umbar was once a city of the [[Númenóreans]] at the height of their power in Middle-earth, now it is a mighty haven of corsairs. Bellakar and Thôn an-Khârlôkh are former colonies, far to the south, and the books do not mention their names.| Description from Workshop page}}

[[IMAGE:LotRRealmsInExileScreenshot.png|thumb|right|Screenshot of an active game of Realms in Exile, examining the profile of [[Denethor]]]]
The current version of the game allows players to begin simulating the world starting in [[Third_Age_3000|T.A. 3000]], with future plans to allow for playing as early as [[Second_Age_3320|S.A. 3320]] and as late as [[Fourth Age 120|Fo.A. 120]]. It includes lore and quotes from [[The Lord of the Rings]], with character adaptations and interstitial stills inspired from the [[The_Lord_of_the_Rings_(film_series)|Lord of the Rings film series]].

The mod offers an extensive amount of characters and realms (some canon, others not) to simulate leading. For the [[War of the Ring]] campaign, the featured characters are:

*The Lost Realm of Arnor
**[[Maglor]] ([[Himring]])
**[[Bilbo Baggins]] ([[Hobbiton]])
**[[Elrond]] ([[Imladris]])
**[[Cirdan]] ([[Lindon]])
**[[Aragorn]] (Roaming with [[Dúnedain]])
**Madogh ([[Enedwaith|Saralain]])
*Over Misty Mountains Cold
**Brokkr ([[Dwalin]]'s folk)
**[[Gorkil]] ([[Goblin town]])
**[[Gorgol]] ([[Gundabad]])
**Úri VI ([[Firebeards]])
**Mazog (Roaming with host)
**[[Balin]] ([[Longbeards]])
**[[Dáin]] ([[Longbeards]])
*Battle Under the Trees
**[[Grimbeorn]] ([[Beornings]])
**[[Thranduil]] ([[Mirkwood]])
**[[Bain]] ([[Dale]])
**Hawin ([[Dorwinion]])
**[[Galadriel]] ([[Lothlórien]])
**[[Khamûl]] ([[Amon Lanc]])
**Huz-Margoz ([[Rhûn]])
*The Siege of Gondor
**[[Denethor]] ([[Gondor]])
**[[Sauron]] ([[Mordor]])
**[[Adrahil]] ([[Dol Amroth]])
**[[Black_serpent|Suladân]] ([[Harad|Haruzan]])
**Kathuphazgan ([[Umbar]])
**Vangaris ([[Khand]])
*The Horse and the Rider
**Brynjarrson ([[Dunland]])
**[[Saruman]] ([[Isengard]])
**[[Théoden]] ([[Rohan]])
*Shadow on the Sands (non-canon southern lords)
*Princes of the South (non-canon south-western lords)
